title: Package Introduction
text: dummy_data, following columns: id patient identifier. treatment treatment assignment. s1 first stratification factor. s2 second stratification factor. covar continuous covariate. y continuous outcome. y_b binary outcome.

what: Obtain Treatment Effect for Continuous Outcome
title: Package Introduction
text: simplest case continuous outcome, want adjust covar, s1, covar covariate s1 stratification factor. Randomization permuted-block randomization stratified s1. proper model use y ~ treatment * s1 + covar. can also use Huber-White variance estimator setting vcov = "vcovHC". Please note case, model formula contain treatment interaction stratification factors.
code: robin_glm(y ~ treatment * s1 + covar, data = dummy_data, treatment = treatment ~ pb(s1)) #> Treatment Effect #> ------------- #> Model        :  y ~ treatment * s1 + covar  #> Randomization:  treatment ~ pb(s1)  #> Marginal Mean:  #> counter-factual prediction #>  #>       pbo      trt1      trt2  #> 0.2003208 0.7639709 0.9712499  #>  #> Marginal Mean Variance:  #>         pbo        trt1        trt2  #> 0.004581934 0.005765279 0.005858859  #>  #>  #> Variance Type:  vcovG  #>             Estimate Std.Err Z Value Pr(>|z|)     #> trt1 - pbo     0.564   0.101    5.60  2.2e-08 *** #> trt2 - pbo     0.771   0.101    7.61  2.8e-14 *** #> trt2 - trt1    0.207   0.107    1.94    0.052 .   #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 robin_glm(y ~ treatment + s1 + covar, data = dummy_data, treatment = treatment ~ pb(s1), vcov = "vcovHC") #> Treatment Effect #> ------------- #> Model        :  y ~ treatment + s1 + covar  #> Randomization:  treatment ~ pb(s1)  #> Marginal Mean:  #> counter-factual prediction #>  #>       pbo      trt1      trt2  #> 0.2004488 0.7639780 0.9712848  #>  #> Marginal Mean Variance:  #>         pbo        trt1        trt2  #> 0.004480119 0.005685396 0.005911814  #>  #>  #> Variance Type:  vcovHC  #>             Estimate Std.Err Z Value Pr(>|z|)     #> trt1 - pbo     0.564   0.101    5.60  2.1e-08 *** #> trt2 - pbo     0.771   0.102    7.57  3.7e-14 *** #> trt2 - trt1    0.207   0.108    1.92    0.055 .   #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

what: Obtain Treatment Effect for Binary Outcome
title: Package Introduction
text: outcome binary, want adjust covar, s1, covar covariate s1 stratification factor. Randomization permuted-block randomization stratified s1. proper model use y_b ~ treatment * s1 + covar. Note need specify family binomial(link = "logit").
code: robin_glm(y_b ~ treatment * s1 + covar, data = dummy_data, treatment = treatment ~ pb(s1), family = binomial(link = "logit")) #> Treatment Effect #> ------------- #> Model        :  y_b ~ treatment * s1 + covar  #> Randomization:  treatment ~ pb(s1)  #> Marginal Mean:  #> counter-factual prediction #>  #>       pbo      trt1      trt2  #> 0.3560965 0.5806957 0.6213865  #>  #> Marginal Mean Variance:  #>         pbo        trt1        trt2  #> 0.001128902 0.001184599 0.001157268  #>  #>  #> Variance Type:  vcovG  #>             Estimate Std.Err Z Value Pr(>|z|)     #> trt1 - pbo    0.2246  0.0477    4.71  2.5e-06 *** #> trt2 - pbo    0.2653  0.0475    5.58  2.4e-08 *** #> trt2 - trt1   0.0407  0.0479    0.85      0.4     #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

title: Package Introduction
text: outcome count, want adjust covariates, can use family = MASS::negative.binomial(theta = NA), correctly optimize theta. Otherwise can also fixed theta know truth. negative binomial link function, also possible use Poisson link function.
code: dummy_data$y_count <- rpois(nrow(dummy_data), lambda = 20) robin_glm(   y_count ~ treatment * s1 + covar,   data = dummy_data,   treatment = treatment ~ pb(s1), family = MASS::negative.binomial(theta = 1) ) #> Treatment Effect #> ------------- #> Model        :  y_count ~ treatment * s1 + covar  #> Randomization:  treatment ~ pb(s1)  #> Marginal Mean:  #> counter-factual prediction #>  #>      pbo     trt1     trt2  #> 19.15272 20.06258 20.59901  #>  #> Marginal Mean Variance:  #>        pbo       trt1       trt2  #> 0.09028392 0.11338830 0.10294317  #>  #>  #> Variance Type:  vcovG  #>             Estimate Std.Err Z Value Pr(>|z|)     #> trt1 - pbo     0.910   0.453    2.01  0.04438 *   #> trt2 - pbo     1.446   0.439    3.29  0.00099 *** #> trt2 - trt1    0.536   0.466    1.15  0.24919     #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

title: Package Introduction
text: randomization schema permuted-block randomization, can use randomization schema. Currently also sp(simple), pb(permuted-block), ps(Pocock-Simon).
code: robin_glm(y_b ~ treatment * s1 + covar, data = dummy_data, treatment = treatment ~ ps(s1), family = binomial(link = "logit")) #> Treatment Effect #> ------------- #> Model        :  y_b ~ treatment * s1 + covar  #> Randomization:  treatment ~ ps(s1)  #> Marginal Mean:  #> counter-factual prediction #>  #>       pbo      trt1      trt2  #> 0.3560965 0.5806957 0.6213865  #>  #> Marginal Mean Variance:  #>         pbo        trt1        trt2  #> 0.001128902 0.001184599 0.001157268  #>  #>  #> Variance Type:  vcovG  #>             Estimate Std.Err Z Value Pr(>|z|)     #> trt1 - pbo    0.2246  0.0477    4.71  2.5e-06 *** #> trt2 - pbo    0.2653  0.0475    5.58  2.4e-08 *** #> trt2 - trt1   0.0407  0.0479    0.85      0.4     #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

what: ROBust INference for Covariate Adjustment in Randomized clinical trials
title: ROBust INference for Covariate Adjustment in Randomized clinical trials
text: RobinCar2 package provide robust inference covariate adjusted analysis stratified randomization. methods implemented recommended FDA guidance covariate adjustment. methods based work Ye, Shao, Yi Zhao (2023), Ye, Bannick, Yi Shao (2023), Ye, Shao, Yi (2023) Bannick, Shao, Liu, Du, Yi, Ye (2024).

title: Covariate adjusted glm model — robin_glm
text: Covariate adjusted glm model

title: Covariate adjusted glm model — robin_glm
code: robin_glm(   formula,   data,   treatment,   contrast = "difference",   contrast_jac = NULL,   vcov = "vcovG",   family = gaussian(),   vcov_args = list(),   ... )

title: Covariate adjusted glm model — robin_glm
text: formula (formula) formula analysis. data (data.frame) Input data frame. treatment (formula character(1)) formula treatment assignment assignment stratification, string name treatment assignment. contrast (function character(1)) function calculate treatment effect, character "difference", "risk_ratio", "odds_ratio" default contrasts. contrast_jac (function) function calculate Jacobian contrast function. Ignored using default contrasts. vcov (function) function calculate variance-covariance matrix treatment effect, including vcovHC vcovG. family (family) family object glm model. vcov_args (list) Additional arguments passed vcov. ... Additional arguments passed glm glm.nb.

title: Covariate adjusted glm model — robin_glm
text: family MASS::negative.binomial(NA), function use MASS::glm.nb instead glm.

title: Covariate adjusted glm model — robin_glm
code: robin_glm(   y ~ treatment * s1,   data = dummy_data,   treatment = treatment ~ s1, contrast = "difference" ) #> Treatment Effect #> ------------- #> Model        :  y ~ treatment * s1  #> Randomization:  treatment ~ s1  #> Marginal Mean:  #> counter-factual prediction #>  #>       pbo      trt1      trt2  #> 0.2230481 0.7639923 0.9482753  #>  #> Marginal Mean Variance:  #>         pbo        trt1        trt2  #> 0.004673852 0.005956420 0.005996443  #>  #>  #> Variance Type:  vcovG  #>             Estimate Std.Err Z Value Pr(>|z|)     #> trt1 - pbo     0.541   0.103    5.26  1.4e-07 *** #> trt2 - pbo     0.725   0.103    7.04  1.9e-12 *** #> trt2 - trt1    0.184   0.109    1.69    0.091 .   #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1

title: Treatment Effect — treatment_effect
text: object Object obtain treatment effect. pair (integer character) Names index treatment levels. variance (function) Variance function. eff_measure (function) Treatment effect measurement function. eff_jacobian (function) Treatment effect jacobian function. vcov_args (list) Additional arguments variance. ... Additional arguments variance.

title: RobinCar2 0.1.0.9000
